lines.text: Laugh, clown, laugh... even though your heart is breaking!

[Last Lines]
The comedy... is... ended!
[Flik/Tito dies onstage in Simon's arms]

[watching from offstage]
That's Flik on the floor.

[watching from offstage]
He's playing that he's dead.
Swells like him don't marry tight-rope walkers.
If all my dreams were like this - I would sleep forever.
It isn't a dream, Tito - it's real! I'm going to tell Luigi - now! And then Lake Como - you and I!
Foot lights! Clear the stage! Ring up the curtain! Let the comedy begin!
Why should I... spoil her youth... with my tears?

[First Lines]
Spring comes early in the Italian hills. Peasant hearts are light - and the voice of the travelling circus is heard in the land...
Some poor family with too many babes abandoned her - for the Saints to take care of.
You mean for us to care for! Give her to the orphanage - women bring bad luck!
No, Simon, what the Saints have sent, sinners can't refuse. I'm going to keep her!
She is a feather for grace, Tito - that little one! But she looks too young! Fix her hair - make her a woman!
That barbed wire was not intended for your pretty little legs.
What a lovely child of Nature you are! What an alluring woman you could be!
[Kisses Simonetta's bare feet]
Luigi! Send that peasant away!
In the pattern of human life there are many strange threads. Three years later... in the office of a famous neurologist in Rome.
Count Ravelli, your spells of uncontrollable laughter are due to a life of self-indulgence.
You know - I think you'd be good for me.
And I've been thinking - you'd be good for me.
Shall we try...
